titleStmt.title: The argument of Nicholas Fuller of Grayes Inne esquire, in the case of Tho. Lad, and Rich. Mansell his clients. Wherein it is plainly proved, that the ecclesiasticall commissioners have no power by their commission, to imprison, or to fine any of his Majesties subjects, or to put them to the oath ex officio.
titleStmt.author: Fuller, Nicholas, 1543-1620.
Marshall, William, fl. 1650.

notesStmt.note: Frontispiece port.: William Laud Arch-B: of Canterbury Prymat of England. W.M. sculp.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
